venue.address_2: * Look for the state boat launch signs*
venue.name: Salmon River Cove

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Its time for you to get used to a bit earlier events since its a way to avoid any possible traffic.

Besides in this case we have a tide issue if its later at this location so its 10:am.

I am listing this location because the tides will be in our favor this weekend only, its a relatively close location for most, the after party is at a private home in Meriden which is not all that far.

. ..BRING SOME WOOD..YOUR CHAIRS, ...."bugg juice"  for you to consume or share, and some Pot luck food..

Directions provided to those going either at the paddle site or via e mail if necessary.

----------------------------------------

This paddling location is also unique because of the Ghost Town on the way along with the Tunnel of LOVE.

There is also a waterfall with some other interesting features to explore,

Join me if you are interested, stay home if you are not.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WEATHER:     Sunday: Patchy fog before 9am. Otherwise, partly sunny, with a high near 79. South wind between 3 and 9 mph.  This is OK so far !

 

TIDE:

Tides for Higganum Creek starting with May 28, 2011.
Day        High      Tide  Height   Sunrise    Moon  Time      % Moon
           /Low      Time    Feet    Sunset                    Visible


Su  29      Low   5:47 AM     0.4   5:20 AM    Rise  3:05 AM      14
    29     High  10:58 AM     2.1   8:15 PM     Set  5:25 PM
    29      Low   5:32 PM     0.6
    29     High  11:16 PM     2.8

Tides for Haddam starting with May 28, 2011.

Day        High      Tide  Height   Sunrise    Moon  Time      % Moon
           /Low      Time    Feet    Sunset                    Visible



Su  29      Low   5:15 AM     0.4   5:20 AM    Rise  3:05 AM      14
    29     High  10:38 AM     2.2   8:15 PM     Set  5:24 PM
    29      Low   5:00 PM     0.7
    29     High  10:56 PM     3.0

 

#################################################### Getting There: The best way to get to this PUT IN location by SALMON COVE is by using the same directions to GOODSPEED OPRAH HOUSE,

For GPS use apx # 117 East Haddam Moodus Road, East Haddam.

The Meetup* location Map link above is correct for a visual map. Getting There, From Hartford: take I-91 south: take Exit 22s. (left hand exit) = Route 9 South , take Exit 7, (rte 82 to the Goodspeed Oprah House. At the end of the exit ramp take a left onto Middlesex tpk=rte 154 for a few hundred feet then back onto rte 82 east, cross the river and pass the oprah house and slow down. Take a sharp left onto rte 149 at the Gelston House. Be Careful at this intersection. The State boat ramp sign and road is 1 mile north oN the left after you turned from the Opra House to the North..

look FOR THE BROWN BOAT LAUNCH SIGN.

--------------------------------------------------------------

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

KAYAKS AVAILABLE: 

 

###  Some Kayaks are available if you want to use one of mine:

ANY of MY KAYAKS need to be reserved prior to me leaving for the PADDLE SITE preferably by the night prior to or the event: (i may not get a chance to check the site in the morning of the event).

Yes its a STRAPPING & WAPPING $20.00 PER FULL DAY for kayak types and brands you simply can not get from any other source. Or rent the ones they have at EMS or where ever if my yaks are not OK for you.

(This is really a donation i do need to maintain, repair, and add new equipment over time. it also covers the costs of the Decent Quality boats with all the Special accessories and the transportation to and from the site.)


I have some cheap life jackets and some GOOD ones, (Remember a decent life jacket should be a top quality one, its really a form of cheap life insurance so you can enjoy your life in the long run).
One is a Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me, but i like the way it works.http://www.rei.com/product/751058

&  another one is :   http://www.watersports.co/womens-kayak-life-vests/c1000001793/stohlquist-towmotion-womens-kayak-life-jacket-2010-p219446.html

If using my boats you have to wear the life jacket, i can't be responsible for your stupidity if you don't since its common knowledge to practice safety in this and all other paddling groups that things happen when its least expected..etc

Besides, i spent over $100 for your safety, don't stuff it in the back somewhere.

#### 
All my yaks come with the TOP RATED Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles because they are Hollow and light (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.)
You choose your preference.http://www.wernerpaddles.com/paddles/touring/performance_core/kalliste/
####

Also for comfort is my favourite "Yak Pad's" optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere. http://www.yakpads.com/11-paddle-saddle-with-high-backrest.html 
####

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:http://www.kayakproshop.com/SL_deckbag.html

####

PLEASE INDICATE WHICH KAYAK YOU FIT IN AND OR CAN HANDLE in your RSVP if you need one of the following Yaks:

(I CAN SUGGEST WHICH ONE IF NEEDED based on your physical size and skills if you are not sure).

####

NEW TO THE FLEET--->KAYAK H.D. :       Home Depot Cull Wood & Luan Plywood Panel Special 15'  (Don't laugh , this boat is acceptable and actually will get finished over the summer or it will be used for a end of the season campfire).

This Kayak was built using scrap wood of all sorts and is now part of the fleet.

It is moderately stable and moves along quite well, (I have not checked its cruising speed or top speed yet). Im sure i will see someone paddling it to shore pretty fast though.

It has a removable Johnson* toile seat and a YakPadz seat back pad available but i have no foot pegs installed yet. Bailing Sponge is included.

---RESERVED---      ---AL-R ---


####

KAYAK 1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide. 

Highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable expedition Sea kayak moderate weight (52 LB).
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills. 
http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer 
---RESERVED---      ---ROB P ---

 

####

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.  http://www.neckykayaks.com/kayaks/touring/eliza_polymer.shtml 

---AVAILABLE---         --- ---


####

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series. http://www.belhavencanoe.com/Necky/Eliza%20Comp/Elizacomp.htm

---AVAILABLE ---        --- ---


####

KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version (Very Thin Fiberglass and now with reinforced floor), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide. 

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit. http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

---AVAILABLE ?---         ---LILLY WONG ?? ---

  

####

KAYAK #5:        Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, fixed skeg 18' @ 19.6" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull (50 lbs). Greenland Paddle available also if REQUESTED. Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills. http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

---RESERVED---           ---AL ---

 

####

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style fast kayak. 18' @ 21" wide

Low initial but high secondary stability when on full edge. Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced paddling skills. 
http://www.atlantickayaktours.com/pages/retail/boats/ndk/Greenlander-Pro.shtml

---AVAILABLE---             --- ---

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: I will wear my Bright Orange Hunting Hat near the put in spot.
item.why: It Raises the HDL Cholesterol factor. GET A DAVID GLASS CAKE FOR THE AFTER PARTY DETAILS: http://www.meetup.com/Forever-Young/events/19876831/

item.name: Sunday May 29 - Kayak Salmon Rvr @ 10:00 am & AFTER PARTY in Meriden @ 3+ pm
